questions.explanation: If we study hard, we will be able to keep pace with other bright students. (যদি আমরা কঠোর পরিশ্রম করি, তাহলে আমরা অন্যান্য মেধাবী শিক্ষার্থীদের সঙ্গে তাল মিলিয়ে চলতে পারব।) “keep pace with” মানে হলো — তাল মিলিয়ে চলা বা সমান অগ্রগতি রাখা। উদাহরণ: You must work hard to keep pace with the class. (ক্লাসের সঙ্গে তাল মিলিয়ে চলতে হলে তোমাকে কঠোর পরিশ্রম করতে হবে।) ভুল অপশনগুলোর কারণ: ক. keep pace at other bright students → “at” prepositionটি এখানে ভুল। খ. keep pace for bright students → “for” উদ্দেশ্য বোঝায়, তাল মেলানো নয়। ঘ. keep pace with weak students → ব্যাকরণগতভাবে ঠিক হলেও অর্থগতভাবে অনুপযুক্ত (দুর্বল শিক্ষার্থীদের সঙ্গে তাল মেলানোর কথা নয় এখানে)।

questions.question: I asked her If she _____ before she started school.
questions.explanation: এটি 2nd Conditional এর উদাহরণ। যেহেতু Past tense এ আছে সুতরাং Fill in the gaps এ Could / would + verb এর base form হবে।

questions.question: If a ruby is heated it ____ temporarily lose its colour.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is will. The sentence is stating a general fact about rubies, not a specific instance. Therefore, the simple present tense "will" is the most appropriate choice. It indicates a future action that is likely to happen under certain conditions conditional এর উদাহরণ, তাই will হবে।

questions.question: He would go mad if he _____that.
questions.explanation: এটি 2nd Conditional এর উদাহরণ । সুতরাং Fill in the gaps এ Simple Past tense হবে।

questions.question: __________________,she would have succeeded.
questions.explanation: Third Conditional : (i) If+ past perfect + sub + could have/would have/ might have+v.p.p. +........ Ex: If he had studied hard, he would have passed. (ii) Had + sub + v.p.p. + ....+ sub+ could have/would have/ might have + v.p.p. + Ex: Had she studied hard, she would have succeeded.

questions.question: Ben would have studied medicine if he___to a medical school.
questions.explanation: Third Conditional (Type 3 Conditional) : এই বাক্যটি third conditional অনুসারে গঠিত, যা অতীতের একটি অসম্ভব বা পরিবর্তনযোগ্য ঘটনা বোঝায়। ➡ Structure of Third Conditional: If + past perfect (had + V 3 ), subject + would have + V 3 ➡ Explanation: "Would have studied" → অতীতে কিছু করার সম্ভাবনা ছিল। "If he had been admitted" → অতীতে মেডিকেল স্কুলে ভর্তি হলে সে পড়াশোনা করতো। "Had been admitted" → এটি past perfect passive (কারণ Ben নিজে ভর্তি করেনি, বরং তাকে ভর্তি করা হয়েছিল)।

questions.question: If I had managed to repair my car earlier, I ____ you to London.
questions.explanation: এটি 3rd Conditional এর উদাহরণ । তাই could have driven বসবে ।

questions.question: If you concede an idea, you ___.
questions.explanation: Concode অর্থ সত্য বলে স্বীকার করা। If you concede an idea, you ___.” এটা Conditional sentence (Zero Conditional) এর structure। Structure: If + present simple, present simple ব্যাখ্যা: If you concede an idea → present simple you acknowledge it as true → present simple এখানে কোনো ভবিষ্যৎ বা কল্পনা নয়, বরং general truth / universal fact বোঝানো হয়েছে।

questions.question: If you fail to ___ the payments on the car, the company will come and repossess it.
questions.explanation: Fail to meet - দিতে ব্যর্থ হওয়া।

questions.question: He………… to see us if he had been able to.
A sixteen-year-old is ( not to ) vote in national elections. (Right from of verbs)
questions.explanation: সঠিক উত্তর হলো খ. old enough । ব্যাখ্যা (Right Form of Verbs & Adjective position): এই শূন্যস্থানে গ্রামারের 'Enough' ব্যবহারের নিয়মটি প্রয়োগ করা হয়েছে। নিয়মটি হলো: Adjective + Enough: যখন 'Enough' কোনো Adjective (যেমন: old, smart, strong) এর সাথে বসে, তখন 'Enough' সবসময় ওই Adjective-টির পরে বসে। [১] বাক্য বিশ্লেষণ: "A sixteen-year-old is not old enough to vote in national elections." (অর্থাৎ, একজন ১৬ বছর বয়সীর জাতীয় নির্বাচনে ভোট দেওয়ার মতো যথেষ্ট বয়স হয়নি।)

questions.question: I had _____ to hear about the sea voyage.
questions.explanation: এখানে neither ....... nor এর ব্যবহার হবে।

questions.question: The miscreant seems___________ the wallet.
questions.explanation: ইতিপূর্বে সংঘটিত ঘটনা বুঝাতে have+verb বসে।

questions.question: The book that you see............. on the table belongs to me.
questions.explanation: see ( verb থাকলে ,পরের verb এর সাথে ing যুক্ত হয়।

questions.question: Choose the correct alternative from the following

options.label: ক
options.text: The film we saw last week was an interesting one

options.label: খ
options.text: film we saw last week was an interesting one.

options.label: গ
options.text: The film we saw last week was interesting one.

options.label: ঘ
options.text: The day before the yesterday he went by air to Europe.

questions.option_a: The film we saw last week was an interesting one
questions.option_b: film we saw last week was an interesting one.
questions.option_c: The film we saw last week was interesting one.
questions.option_d: The day before the yesterday he went by air to Europe.
questions.explanation: Option ক ✅ সঠিক। Sentence: The film we saw last week was an interesting one. Subject + verb + object structure ঠিক আছে। "an interesting one" → সঠিক article ব্যবহার হয়েছে। Option খ ভুল। Sentence: film we saw last week was an interesting one. এখানে subject-এর আগে article নেই। সঠিক হবে: The film we saw last week... Option গ ভুল। Sentence: The film we saw last week was interesting one. এখানে "interesting one" এর আগে article নেই। সঠিক হবে: an interesting one. Option ঘ ভুল। Sentence: The day before the yesterday he went by air to Europe. "the day before yesterday" → সঠিক idiomatic expression। এখানে অতিরিক্ত "the" বসানো হয়েছে। সঠিক হবে: The day before yesterday he went by air to Europe. ✅ Final Answer ক → The film we saw last week was an interesting one

questions.question: The boy was so dirty that he looked as if he ____ in the mud.
questions.explanation: সঠিক উত্তরটি হলো "had been lying"। এখানে "had been lying" ব্যবহৃত হয়েছে, কারণ বাক্যটি অতীতের একটি ঘটনা বর্ণনা করছে ("was so dirty", "looked as if")। বালকটির নোংরা হওয়ার কারণ হিসেবে কাদার মধ্যে শুয়ে থাকার কাজটিও অতীতেই শুরু হয়েছিল এবং সেই নোংরা হওয়ার পূর্ব পর্যন্ত চলছিল। অতীতের কোনো একটি নির্দিষ্ট সময়ের আগে থেকে শুরু হয়ে সেই সময় পর্যন্ত চলতে থাকা কোনো কাজ বোঝাতে Past Perfect Continuous Tense ব্যবহার করা হয়। তাই "had been lying" সবচেয়ে উপযুক্ত।

questions.question: Yesterday _____ of the students were absent.
questions.explanation: Subject হিসেবে থাকা Fraction এর যদি numerator (লব) টি one হয় তবে verb memgq Singular হয় আর যদি লব টি Plural (two-three) হর তবে Denominator (হর) সবসময় Plural হয়, এবং Denominator (হর) এর পরবর্তী noun অনুসারে verb হয় অর্থাৎ noun টি Countable হলে verb Plural এবং Uncountable হলে Verb singular হয় । Exam: One-third of the book is not good. Two-thirds of the mangoes are rotten.

questions.question: We look forward to ——.
If you want to grow as a business and attract new customers you must _________ with the times.
questions.explanation: move with the time to change and become more modern example we have to move with the times and market our books more

questions.question: When Henry arrived home after a hard day at work ____.
questions.explanation: 1. Past Continuous Tense : In this sentence, "was sleeping" is used. The past continuous tense is formed with the past tense of the verb "to be" (was/were) and the present participle of the main verb (sleeping). This tense is used to describe actions that were ongoing at a specific point in the past. 2. Adverbial Clause : The introductory phrase "When Henry arrived home after a hard day at work" serves as an adverbial clause, providing context for the main action in the sentence. It indicates the time frame when the main action occurred. 3. Past Action : The sentence implies that Henry arrived home after his hard day at work, and at that moment, his wife was already in the state of sleeping. Therefore, the past continuous tense ("was sleeping") is appropriate to describe the ongoing action of sleeping at the time of Henry's arrival. 4. Correct Verb Form : The verb "to sleep" is used in its past participle form ("was sleeping") to match the past continuous tense and agree with the subject "his wife." 5. Logical Sequence : The use of the past continuous tense in this context helps to convey the sequence of events logically. It indicates that the action of sleeping was already in progress when Henry arrived home, providing a clear and coherent narrative. In summary, option "ঘ his wife was sleeping" follows grammatical rules by using the past continuous tense to describe an ongoing action in the past and effectively conveys the intended meaning of the sentence.

questions.question: I wish I _____ my homework last night.
questions.explanation: • Present wish এর ক্ষেত্রে Past form হয়। Example: I wish it wasn't so cold. • Past wish এর ক্ষেত্রে Past perfect form হয়। Example: I wish I had not spent money last month. • Future wish এর ক্ষেত্রে would/could হয়। Example: That's a painfull noise. I wish it would stop.

questions.question: Look forward to....... from you soon.
questions.explanation: Look forward to/ With a view to/ Accustomed to /Dedicate to /+(v+ing) Ex: He looked forward to hearing from me.

questions.question: Without the new taxes, houses built before World War-II often _____________ lower costs than more modern homes do.
questions.explanation: Subject টি plural হওয়ায় verb হিসেবে have বসবে।

questions.question: We ------- a test when the lights went out.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is "were doing." This sentence is describing an ongoing action that was interrupted by another event. The past continuous tense, formed with "were doing," is used to express actions that were happening at a specific point in the past. In this case, the action of taking a test was in progress when the lights went out. Let's briefly discuss why the other options are incorrect: "have done": This is in the present perfect tense, which is not suitable for describing an action that was interrupted in the past. Present perfect is used for actions that have relevance to the present. "are doing": This is in the present continuous tense, indicating an action happening at the current moment. It doesn't fit the context of a past event. "do": This is in the simple present tense and doesn't convey the sense of an ongoing action in the past.

questions.question: we should use –– time we have at our disposal to settle the dispute.
questions.explanation: Option A is correct because 'little' is used with uncountable nouns like 'time'. The other options are incorrect as 'few' is used with countable nouns and 'of' is unnecessary in this context.

questions.question: Who _____ was going to conduct the test?
questions.explanation: The correct completion of the sentence is "Who did you say was going to conduct the test?" The given sentence is an interrogative sentence in Past indefinite tense. Option C completes the correct structure of Past indifinite sentence.

questions.question: It rains a lot here. I wish it ____ rain so often.
questions.explanation: Sentence: "It rains a lot here. I wish it ____ rain so often." Explanation wish + past tense → বর্তমানের বিপরীত অবস্থা বোঝাতে ব্যবহৃত হয়। এখানে বাস্তব সত্য হলো → It rains a lot here. বক্তা চাইছে যেন তা না হতো → অর্থাৎ unreal situation। তাই সঠিক হবে: I wish it didn’t rain so often.

questions.question: I wish I ____ him, but I don't.
questions.explanation: Sentence: "I wish I ____ him, but I don't." Explanation এখানে wish এর পরে সাধারণত past tense ব্যবহার হয়, যখন বাস্তবে তা সত্য নয়। বাক্যে বলা হয়েছে → "but I don't" → অর্থাৎ বাস্তবে আমি তাকে পছন্দ করি না। তাই সঠিক হবে I wish I liked him → আমি চাইতাম যেন তাকে পছন্দ করতাম, কিন্তু করি না।

questions.question: Anis went to Dhaka ____ seeing his mother in hospital.
questions.explanation: With a view to, look forward to, Confess to, object to এর পরে verb এর ing যুক্ত হয়। সুতরাং Fill in the gaps এ with a view to হবে।

questions.question: Identify the one underlined word or phrase that should be corrected. She is looking forward to go to USA after she finishes her studies at the university.
questions.explanation: The phrase 'looking forward to' should be followed by a gerund (verb+ing) form. So it should be 'going' instead of 'go'.

questions.question: _____ a car when they were living in London?
questions.explanation: অতীত কালের ঘটনা বোঝাতে Did ব্যবহৃত হয়েছে। আর প্রশ্নবোধক বাক্যের শুরুতে did আসলে মূল verb টি Present form এ হয়।

questions.question: You can't stop me ........... what I want.
questions.explanation: Can't Stop এর পর Gerund হয়

questions.question: Choose the word or phrase (A,B,C,D or E) that best completes the sentence: She hopes to get married before she_____________thirty.
questions.explanation: এই বাক্যটিতে Time Connector হিসেবে "before" ব্যবহৃত হয়েছে। ইংরেজি গ্রামারের নিয়ম অনুযায়ী, ভবিষ্যৎকাল (Future) নিয়ে কোনো কথা বলার সময় যদি before, after, as soon as, when, বা until -এর মতো শব্দ যুক্ত থাকে, তবে একটি বিশেষ গঠন অনুসরণ করা হয়: Main Clause: এটি Future বা আকাঙ্ক্ষা (যেমন- She hopes/will hope) প্রকাশ করে। Time Clause (before-এর পরের অংশ): এটি ভবিষ্যতে ঘটার কথা থাকলেও গ্রামাটিক্যালি সর্বদা Present Indefinite Tense -এ লিখতে হয়। অর্থাৎ, যদিও তার ৩০ বছর হওয়াটা ভবিষ্যতের ঘটনা, কিন্তু 'before' থাকার কারণে আমাদের Present Indefinite (is) ব্যবহার করতে হবে।

questions.question: A dairy or small notebook ___ short list of tasks to do each day will be very useful.
questions.explanation: একটি মাত্র sub থাকলে Main verb ও একটি হবে। বাক্যে যেহেতু main verb দেওয়া আছে।তাই, খ সঠিক।

questions.question: Some of the people were standing in the gallery ––– the show, while others were cheering the performers.
questions.explanation: একই সময়ে ঘটা দুটি কাজ: যখন একটি বাক্যে দুটি কাজ একই সময়ে চলতে থাকে, তখন একটি অংশ বর্ণনা করতে Present Participle (verb + ing) ব্যবহৃত হয়। এখানে মানুষ গ্যালারিতে দাঁড়িয়ে ছিল এবং একই সময়ে তারা শো-টি দেখছিল। ২. বাক্য গঠন: "Some of the people were standing... watching the show" — এখানে 'watching' অংশটি গ্যালারিতে দাঁড়িয়ে থাকা মানুষগুলোর অবস্থা বা তারা কী করছিল তা বর্ণনা করছে। ৩. Parallelism (সমান্তরালতা): বাক্যের পরের অংশে লক্ষ্য করলে দেখবেন "others were cheering" ব্যবহার করা হয়েছে। অর্থাৎ পুরো বাক্যটি একটি চলমান দৃশ্য বর্ণনা করছে, তাই 'watching' এখানে সবচেয়ে সঠিক।

questions.question: The movie titled The English Patient_____________ audience heavily.
questions.explanation: Affect - প্রভাবিত করা। Effect - ঘটানো বা উৎপন্ন করা । সম্পূর্ণ বাক্যটি হবে- “The movie titled The English Patient affected the audience heavily.” যার অর্থ- “The English Patient নামের সিনেমাটি দর্শকদের ব্যাপকভাবে প্রভাবিত করেছিল।” এখানে “প্রভাবিত করা” অর্থে affected ব্যবহৃত হবে। তাই অপশন “C” হবে সঠিক।

questions.question: The police___________ the murder case.
questions.explanation: এখানে The police একটি plural subject। কারণ The police দ্বারা কোনো পুলিশ সদস্যকে নয় বরং পুরো পুলিশবাহিনীকে বুঝানো হচ্ছে। তাই verb টিও plural “are” হবে। আবার, তদন্ত করা অর্থে Look into হবে।

questions.question: ______________for your co-operation, she would have failed.
questions.explanation: (--) ছাড়া, নইলে, না + অসমাপিকা ক্রিয়া অর্থে But for ব্যবহৃত হয়। But for এর গঠন: But for + noun phrase, Subject + would have +Vpp অথবা would +be + Extension. সঠিক উত্তরটি হলো: ক) But (এখানে মূলত 'But for' হিসেবে ব্যবহৃত)। সম্পূর্ণ বাক্যটি হবে: But for your co-operation, she would have failed. Explanation ১. 'But for' এর ব্যবহার: ইংরেজি ব্যাকরণে "But for" একটি গুরুত্বপূর্ণ ফ্রেজ (Phrase), যার অর্থ হলো "যদি না থাকতো" (if it had not been for)। এটি মূলত কোনো শর্ত বা কারণ বোঝাতে ব্যবহৃত হয় যা কোনো একটি ফলাফলকে বাধা দিয়েছে।

questions.question: Choose the word or phrase (A,B,C,D) that best completes the sentence: Because the first pair of pants did not fit properly, he asked for________.
questions.explanation: The correct option to complete the sentence is "another pair." Explanation: "Another pants": This option is grammatically incorrect because "pants" is a plural noun, and "another" is typically used with singular nouns. The singular form would require "another pair of pants." "Other pants": This option could be considered grammatically correct in some contexts, but it lacks specificity. "Other pants" implies different pants but doesn't necessarily imply a similar type or a replacement, which is more contextually appropriate in this sentence. "The others ones": This option is grammatically incorrect. "Others" is a pronoun that doesn't need the addition of "ones." Also, "the" would be unnecessary unless referring to a specific, previously mentioned set of pants. "Another pair": This is the correct choice. "Pair" is singular and correctly refers to one set of pants. "Another pair" clearly indicates he wants a different set of the same kind of item (in this case, pants), which fits the context of the sentence. So, the complete sentence is: "Because the first pair of pants did not fit properly, he asked for another pair."

questions.question: You want to know the price of something so you say, ____ ?
questions.explanation: 1. Interrogative Structure : When asking about the price of something, we typically use the interrogative pronoun "how" to indicate quantity or extent, and "much" to specify an amount or degree. 2. Verb Usage : In English, the verb "is" is used to link the subject (the item being priced) and the predicate (the price). This is because the verb "to be" is commonly used to express existence, identity, or state of being. 3. Order of Words : In English interrogative sentences, the word order is typically inverted compared to declarative sentences. In this case, the subject ("it") comes after the verb ("is"). 4. Avoiding Redundancy : Using "How much" alone already implies asking about the price, so there's no need to include additional words like "price" or "cost" in the question. 5. Elimination of Incorrect Options : - Option ক: "How many is it?" is incorrect because "how many" is used for countable items, not for asking about the price of something. - Option খ: "How much the price" is grammatically incorrect and redundant. "How much" already implies "the price." - Option গ: "What is costs" is grammatically incorrect. The correct form would be "What does it cost?" or "What is the cost?" 6. Consistency with Standard Usage : "How much is it?" adheres to standard English grammar and usage for inquiring about the price of something. Therefore, by following the rules of interrogative structure, verb usage and word order, "How much is it?" is the correct and natural way to ask about the price of something in English.

questions.option_a: the book was read by many people
questions.option_b: the book made many people want to read it
questions.option_c: many people wanted to read the book
questions.option_d: the reading of the book interested many people
questions.explanation: The correct answer is "many people wanted to read the book." Let's analyze why this is the best choice and why the other options are less suitable: The book was read by many people : This option uses the passive voice ("was read"), which makes it less direct and engaging than an active voice construction. It also doesn't clearly link the cause (seeing the movie) to the effect (people reading the book). The book made many people want to read it : This option is somewhat awkward and repetitive. It personifies the book by suggesting it had the agency to make people want to read it, which is a less natural way of expressing the idea. Many people wanted to read the book : This is the best option. It's straightforward, uses active voice, and clearly links the action of seeing the movie with the desire to read the book. The reading of the book interested many people : This choice is also a bit awkward. It unnecessarily nominalizes the verb "read" into "the reading," which makes the sentence more complex and less direct. It also doesn't make the cause-effect relationship as clear as option 3. So, "After seeing the movie, many people wanted to read the book" is the most clear and direct way of expressing the idea that the movie inspired an interest in reading the book.

"it is very economical" (অর্থনৈতিক হওয়া)। দুটি কারণই স্পষ্ট এবং ব্যাকরণগতভাবে সঠিকভাবে যুক্ত হয়েছে ### **Why Other Options Are Incorrect:** #### **Option ক (Because of its durability and economy):** - **বাংলা:** "Economy" (অর্থনীতি) শব্দটি এখানে বিভ্রান্তিকর। "Economical" (অর্থনৈতিক) হওয়া উচিত ছিল কারণ এটি গাড়ির বৈশিষ্ট্য বোঝাচ্ছে। "Because of" এর পরে noun phrase ঠিক আছে, কিন্তু "economy" ভুল শব্দ। #### **Option গ (Because of its durability and it is economical):** - **বাংলা:** "Because of" এর পরে noun phrase ("its durability") এবং clause ("it is economical") একসাথে ব্যবহার করা যায় না। এটি ব্যাকরণগতভাবে ভুল। #### **Option ঘ (Because durability and economize it is better than all the others):** - **বাংলা:** "Economize" (সাশ্রয় করা) একটি verb, যা "durability" (noun) এর সাথে অসামঞ্জস্যপূর্ণ। বাক্যটি অর্থহীন এবং ব্যাকরণহীন।

Subject-Verb Agreement: এখানে বাক্যের মূল Subject হলো "The facilities" (বহুবচন বা Plural)। তাই Verb অবশ্যই "are" হবে। (এই কারণে অপশন 'ক' ভুল)। ২. Double Comparison (as...as / better than): যখন আমরা বলি "কোনো কিছুর মতো ভালো অথবা তার চেয়ে ভালো", তখন দুটি স্ট্রাকচারই পূর্ণাঙ্গভাবে লিখতে হয়: Positive: as good as Comparative: better than অপশন 'খ' এবং 'ঘ'-তে as good as -এর দ্বিতীয় as টি নেই, তাই সেগুলো ভুল। ৩. Logical Comparison (those of): আমরা যখন তুলনা করি, তখন একই জাতীয় জিনিসের মধ্যে তুলনা করতে হয়। এখানে হাসপাতালের সাথে হাসপাতালের তুলনা হচ্ছে না, বরং নতুন হাসপাতালের সুযোগ-সুবিধার (facilities) সাথে পুরানো হাসপাতালের সুযোগ-সুবিধার তুলনা হচ্ছে। facilities যেহেতু Plural, তাই এর বদলে "those of" ব্যবহার করতে হয়। (শুধুমাত্র 'the old hospital' বললে জুতোর সাথে মানুষের তুলনা করার মতো ভুল শোনায়)

Possessive Pronouns : "Its" is a possessive pronoun, indicating ownership or association with the atom. It is used to show that the increase in energy level belongs to the atom. 3. Clarity and Coherence : Option ক (its energy level) provides a clear and concise completion to the sentence, maintaining coherence in the sentence structure. It specifies that the energy level referred to belongs to the atom, making the sentence easy to understand. 4. Avoidance of Redundancy : Option ক (its energy level) avoids redundancy by directly stating "its energy level," which clearly indicates the energy level of the atom. It is straightforward and does not unnecessarily repeat information already implied by the context of the sentence. Based on these rules and considerations, option ক (its energy level) is the correct completion for the sentence. It adheres to pronoun agreement, uses possessive pronouns correctly, ensures clarity and coherence, and avoids redundancy. Therefore, it provides the most grammatically appropriate and contextually fitting completion for the sentence.

Made: This word is correct; it is the past participle of the verb "make" and is used here to indicate the action of progress. In space: This phrase is correct; it specifies the context of where the progress in space travel occurred. For: The correct preposition in this context is "in." questions.explanation: Apply to সাধারণত Place অথবা Person এর ক্ষেত্রে ব্যবহৃত হয়। Apply for সাধারণত thing, position, loan ইত্যাদি ক্ষেত্রে ব্যবহৃত হয়। Example: Apply for a car loan at the bank. Apply to the loan department at the bank. অনুরুপভাবে - Apply to a hospital for a job as a nurse. From: This preposition doesn't fit in this context. "From" is generally used to indicate a starting point, origin, or source, and it doesn't convey the idea of applying for a job. For: This is the correct choice. "Apply for" is the standard and idiomatic expression when indicating the submission of an application for a job or position. With: "Apply with" is not the typical preposition used in the context of job applications. "With" is more commonly used when referring to the means or tools used to accomplish something. To: "Apply to" is another common expression, but it is often used when referring to educational institutions or specific companies. In this context, "apply to" might suggest a narrower scope of options than "apply for." Therefore, the most appropriate preposition in this sentence is "for": "I intend to apply for a job in the Accounts Department."

questions.question: ______, the club will hold a party next month to celebrate its silver jubilee.
questions.explanation: The correct completion for the sentence is: "Formed twenty-five years ago, the club will hold a party next month to celebrate its silver jubilee." Explanation: - From twenty-five years ago: This phrase is a prepositional phrase, and when placed at the beginning of the sentence, it does not provide a clear connection to the action or subject of the sentence. - Form twenty-five years ago: This phrase is grammatically incorrect. The correct preposition here is "formed." - Twenty-five years ago: This phrase is an adverbial phrase indicating the time when the club was formed. However, when placed at the beginning of the sentence, it lacks the necessary subject and verb to form a complete sentence. - Formed Twenty-five years ago: This phrase is grammatically correct and provides a clear connection to the action of the sentence. It indicates when the club was formed and sets the context for the subsequent information about the club holding a party to celebrate its silver jubilee.

questions.explanation: Tenses Rules and Formula Examples Simple Present Tense Subject + Verb in the base form/third person plural form + the rest of the sentence Keerthi eats bread and butter before going to school. Present Perfect Tense Subject + Helping Verb (have/has) + Past participle of the main verb + the rest of the sentence along with the time frame She has lived here all her life. Simple Past Tense Subject + Verb + ed / verb in the past tense + the rest of the sentence Nupur went to the supermarket yesterday. Past Continuous Tense Subject + Helping Verb(was/were) + Main verb + ing + the rest of the sentence It was snowing today. Past Perfect Tense Subject + Helping Verb (had) + Past participle of the main verb + the rest of the sentence along with the time frame. She had met him before the party. Past Perfect Continuous Tense Subject + Had + Been + Verb + ing + the rest of the sentence He had been drinking milk out the carton when Mom walked into the kitchen. Simple Future Tense Subject + will/shall + V1 + Object I will write articles on different topics. Future Continuous Tense Subject + will be/shall be + V1 + ing + Object I will have been waiting here for three hours by six o’clock. questions.question: The film ____by the time we get to the cinema.
questions.explanation: 1. Future perfect tense: The future perfect tense is used to describe an action that will be completed before a specific point in the future. 2. Rule for future perfect tense: It is formed using the future tense of the auxiliary verb "will" or "shall," the word "have," and the past participle of the main verb. 3. Correct sentence analysis: - "The film" is the subject of the sentence. - "will already have started" is the future perfect verb phrase. - "will" is the future tense auxiliary verb. - "already" indicates that the action will be completed before a certain time. - "have" is the auxiliary verb indicating completion. - "started" is the past participle of the main verb "start." 4. Incorrect options: - "will already start": This option lacks the completion aspect provided by the future perfect tense. - "will already be started": While grammatically correct, it doesn't express the perfect aspect of completion that "will already have started" does. So, the rule involves using the future perfect tense to express actions that will be completed before a specified point in the future.

questions.question: The antonym of 'hope' is ____.
questions.explanation: The word "hope" represents a feeling of optimism or expectation that something desirable will happen in the future. Its antonym should represent the opposite sentiment, which is a feeling of negativity or lack of optimism. 1. Opposite Meaning : "Despair" signifies a complete loss of hope or a feeling of hopelessness. It represents a lack of optimism or belief that things will improve or turn out positively. 2. Contextual Contrast : When someone is experiencing hope, they have a positive outlook and believe that things will get better. Conversely, when someone is in a state of despair, they feel overwhelmed by negativity and see little or no hope for improvement. 3. Semantic Relationship : "Hope" and "despair" are often viewed as contrasting emotions. Where there is hope, there is a belief in the possibility of positive outcomes, while despair implies a sense of defeat or resignation to negative outcomes. Given these explanations, "despair" is the antonym of "hope" because it represents the opposite emotional state and sentiment.

questions.question: She has just left ______ the airport to meet a friend who is coming from Japan.

(সে এইমাত্র একজন বন্ধুর সাথে দেখা করতে এয়ারপোর্টের উদ্দেশ্যে রওনা হয়েছে, যে জাপান থেকে আসছে।) So, the correct answer is option গ।

questions.question: X introduces Y saying, "He is the husband of the granddaughter of the father of my father." How is Y related to X?
questions.explanation: X says: “He is the husband of the granddaughter of the father of my father .” Step by step: Father of my father → X’s grandfather Granddaughter of X’s grandfather → X’s grandfather’s granddaughter can be: X’s aunt (father’s sister) or X himself/herself if male/female? But normally, we consider the lineage down . Usually, it refers to X’s father’s daughter , i.e., X’s sister or X himself if male . But we want a granddaughter , so next generation → X’s daughter . So the granddaughter of X’s grandfather = X’s daughter Husband of X’s daughter = Y Conclusion: Y is X’s son-in-law

questions.explanation: Explanation: In English, “No sooner…than” is a construction used to indicate that one event happens immediately after another. After “No sooner” , we use inversion (auxiliary before the subject) and “than” , not “then”. So the correct structure is: No sooner + had + subject + past participle + than + … Why the other options are incorrect: খ) No sooner they arrived… than → missing inversion ( should be “had they arrived” ) গ) No sooner had they arrived… then → wrong connector; must be than , not then ঘ) No sooner they had arrived… then → both wrong; missing inversion and wrong connector Final sentence: No sooner had they arrived at the conference venue than they realized their presentation file had been misplaced.

questions.question: It is high time students ---- mental health seriously and sought counseling when needed.

This is a special usage called the subjunctive mood in English . So: It is high time students took mental health seriously… ✔ Why the other options are incorrect: ক) take → Present tense; not correct after “It is high time” খ) should take → Grammatically possible but not standard in this formal subjunctive construction ঘ) will take → Future tense; does not fit the “high time” expression Final sentence: It is high time students took mental health seriously and sought counseling when needed.

Why the other options are incorrect: ক) submit → Base form; incorrect for past tense context. খ) had submitted → Past perfect is unnecessary unless another past action is specified as occurring after this one. ঘ) would submit → Conditional/future; does not fit the past context. Note: Although “students” is plural, the phrase “neither of” makes the subject singular, so submitted is correct.

questions.question: I arrived over an hour late to the office and everyone was working. Actually, they ----- for over two hours on the new project and I felt really guilty.
questions.explanation: The sentence sets up a past reference point : “I arrived over an hour late to the office” → a specific moment in the past. Then it describes an action that started earlier and continued up to that past moment : “for over two hours on the new project” → duration before arrival. To express an action that was ongoing before another past action , we use the past perfect continuous tense . So: they had been working for over two hours ✔ Why the other options are incorrect: ক) work Present tense; does not fit a past narrative. খ) worked Simple past; does not emphasize the duration and continuity before arrival. ঘ) was working Past continuous, but it describes an action happening at a specific past time, not one that started earlier and continued up to that time. Final sentence: Actually, they had been working for over two hours on the new project and I felt really guilty.

questions.question: The laptop _____ last semester is already having technical
questions.explanation: The sentence describes a laptop purchased before another past reference point ( already having technical issues ). To indicate that one past action ( buying the laptop ) happened before another past action ( it having issues ), we use the past perfect tense : had bought . Why the other options are incorrect: ক) that he bought → simple past; could work in casual speech but does not clearly indicate the earlier past action . গ) that he buy → incorrect verb form; present tense, ungrammatical here. ঘ) he bought → grammatically incomplete as a relative clause; needs “that” . Final sentence: The laptop that he had bought last semester is already having technical problems.

Final sentence: None of the donors was willing to increase their donations and charity went broke.

questions.question: If you had eaten a good breakfast, you --- so hungry now.

Final sentence: If you had eaten a good breakfast, you wouldn’t be so hungry now.
